channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2025020093
item.description:
Report E-2025020093

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.

item.title: Report E-2025020052
item.description:
Report E-2025020052

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-04
  • City: PARMA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 8500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding damaged plastic bags of hazardous product, ABF-004. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 1lb release from two bags onto the wooden trailer floor in a 4’ x 4’ area and the concrete dock floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of improper loading. The contractor cleaned-up the release using a HEPA vac. Two 55-gallon DF’s containing the damaged bags of product, impacted PPE, and impacted plastic were generated for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste created from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025010428
item.description:
Report E-2025010428

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-04T06:26:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-24
  • City: HUBER HEIGHTS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately a half (.5) gallon of material released from one (1) 330-gallon IBC tote due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the tote being cracked. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.
